caption: We were nicely greeted by what seemed like the owner of the restaurant and the waitstaff. We ordered two bottles of Pinot Noir which were delicious. We ordered the French onion soup and the scallop tartar which was the special, both were yummy. Then we ordered the steak tartare, and another special which was the fish and carrots the mushroom pasta and the steak ribs. We were told the steak ribs was sold out which was fine so we went with the crock Monsour. The steak tartare was under seasoned and lacked many classic ingredients. The Crock monsuir egg was completely raw however was yummy. The linguine was extremely under-seasoned and lacked flavour and the fish special with the carrots was honestly inedible. The service was amazing and the atmosphere was lovely but a miss from us.

Les Fous is beautiful inside, exactly what you want from a French brasserie. We enjoyed our meal, however they were understaffed, so we had several long waits. The menu is traditional French.  French Onion soup was lovely. The entrecote was disappointing. Steak tartare was very good. Wine list was excellent and the wait staff were lovely, they just needed one more staff member.

Go! If your experience was like ours you, will love it. The menu changes often and is on chalkboard in French and English. Our server Jean was our friendly and knowledgeable guide through this delightful meal. It was the perfect meal for our last night in Paris.

I arrived at this establishment upon the recommendation of a close acquaintance, with the intention of indulging in a delightful dinner featuring cake. The venue itself, as well as its concept and decor, exude a remarkable level of creativity. Although the menu was concise, it offered an array of excellent options complemented by a select assortment of impressive wines. Furthermore, the atmosphere encapsulated a sense of tradition, and naturally, the location was impeccable.

This place was highly recommended by a Parisian friend, and we had high hopes. While it was good, it was not as great as we were hoping. For starter, I had the asparagus soup, which was delicious. For my main, I had the fillet mignon, which, much to my surprise, was almost cooked "well done." I always like beef cooked medium rare and never had to be too specific about this in France, but this was an unhappy accident (maybe its because they seem to be catering mostly tourists that ask for disappointing well done steaks ?). For dessert, I had a chocolate cake, which was a massive disappointment - dry and unremarkable - something that would only be fit if this would be someone's first cake. The service was great, and the sommelier gave us some very good recommendations.

Wonderful food with great wine pairings, attentive service and a lovely quiet location. It was our first time here and it was on NY's eve. We will be back for sure on our next visit to Paris. Les Fous de l'Ile can't wait to come back.

An absolute gem of a restaurant with world class food, world class service and the perfect ambiance for a Parisienne spot.  The sea bass was exceptional as were the escargot, bone marrow and pate. And the prices were very good considering the quality of the food.  Best restaurant we‚Äôve ever eaten at on our Paris visits.  Most HIGHLY recommended!

Beware, change of direction! I had previously been 3 times to this restaurant which I have always loved, but unfortunately it‚Äôs no longer the same experience. Upon arrival, noticing the decor and ambiance had lost its charm, I was already worried. From there it was a disaster‚Ä¶ a bland ‚Äòclassic bistro‚Äô menu and a worthlessly short and poor wine list confirmed that the restaurant had changed hands. They made a mistake on 2 of our starters, and the 3rd had to be re-heated as arrived cold. We were told at late notice that they had run out of their signature aligot and mashed potatoes yet could offer chips or saut√©ed potatoes (clearly not home-made as otherwise could have been mashed) despite there being only a few tables before us. They didn‚Äôt have the wine we wanted (despite such a limited selection) the food was as bland as the menu itself and the waiters tried their best to reassure the entire complaining restaurant as the service was so long, but were stressed and making mistakes all the way along. After a ripoff meal we appreciate the gesture of a free dessert but I could have made it better myself at home. The new direction has ruined what was a fantastic establishment, which is unacceptable in Paris with so many incredibly alternatives. All the guests were rolling their eyes and trying to laugh between us to keep up spirits but it was clear none of us would be back.

Good options on the menu and the restaurant has a good feel to it. The staff were very helpful and they all spoke English. They have a very extensive wine list but I had a beer and mineral water. I stated with Octopus Carpaccio which was delicious. Every mouthful was packed full of flavour. 10/10. For main I has Veal cheek with mash potato. The dish was under seasoned for my taste and also has a piece of something in the mash that was not meant to be there, but these things happen. The under seasoning was easily fixed by adding salt and pepper myself. The veal was cooked perfectly. Then to finish I has cheese, which was a selection of 3 different cheeses, a soft sheep‚Äôs, a Brie and a hard cheese which was very good.

They recently reopened under the same name.  Everything was just overdone.  I had snails that were dry and flavorless, my husband's medium rare steak was well done.  They did redo the steak no questions asked and the second was better, but again not much flavor.

The heart of the restaurant‚Äôs concerns is the product! We appreciate that restaurant respect the producers, always presents the fresh seasonal product! We were so enjoyed our ultra-fresh fish and vegetables, simple but delicious! We definitely come back, strongly recommend this restaurant.

We were recommended Fous by a friend that had lived in Paris previously and we were very impressed. The staff were all very kind, friendly and attentive. Our meals were exceptional both in flavor and presentation. Highly recommend.

Popular and nice place to spend the evening.  The vine range is really great, and professional personel will give you a hand if you need it, according to the choise of the food.  But for me there is a little lack of main dishes (especially concerning French cuisine). Which make this place look a little bit as cafe to have a good time with vine and refreshements, than restaurant for celebration.  Anyway steak and liver were great, profiteroles and almond pie were OK, and it looks like we can return here to taste another vine with some snaks üëç  P.S. be prepared to see high prices for a good quality.

Searched for a place for dinner and came here. Was a great choice! Service was great and atmosphere with food as well. I had the frog legs and steak dinner with crepe orange flammed Grand Marnier. All was great, and I did not disappoint. Learned new ownership and chef with new release a week ago. It's definitely a great choice, and I will come again when visiting Paris in 2025. Don't miss out!
I've been coming here since they opened, never had a bad meal. Bone marrow was a 10/10 and the desserts were definitely a nice finish.

Agreed with many comments: Nice decoration, great location, price is ok, but the food are extremely average. My truffe linguine has no truffe flavor at all, I can make it better at home. Burger is just an average burger. The waitress with long grey hair is typical French always with a bit of sarcasme.  She seems unhappy that we only ordered kir and carafe d‚Äôeau, not sparkling water or more wine. We only ordered one dessert, and she goes ‚ÄúI‚Äôll bring you strictly only one spoon, not two!‚Äù With a smile. Still a lovely night with my friends.

Dinner on the Valentine‚Äôs day üåπ The pumpkin soup, fish, beef and the dessert üßÅ were very nice. It was much crowded and we had to book almost 2 weeks ago but the service and foods were nice. Also, the chicken üêî decoration is fun even in the restroom ! ‚Ä¶

Great restaurant on ile St Louis. Wonderful staff managed by the gracious Caroline. Everyone talks about the ice cream next door, but I'm more impressed with the cafe au lait she makes-- really fine. Nice cozy atmosphere to dine and reasonable prices. Liked the place so much that we went back for dinner. While ordering food from one of the outdoor tables, it suddenly began to rain and we quickly transferred to a full house inside the restaurant. What was really impressive was how Caroline managed a packed restaurant with a smile on her face under a lot of pressure (new people arrived at the door who she couldn't accommodate).  She her spent time with every single guest making sure they were happy and they clearly enjoyed/appreciated her presence. If she ever wanted to be a teacher of hotel/restaurant management, she is natural-- but she probably has more fun running a restaurant.
Delicious food. Pleasant atmosphere. Friendly and efficient staff.

The best meal we had during 3 days in Paris ‚≠êÔ∏è  As a foodie, you come to Paris excited under the assumption it will be brimming with delicious food on every corner only to quickly become a little disappointed by the sea of restaurants serving mediocre food at premium prices aimed at tourists. It becomes overwhelming and a little exhausting trying to find somewhere truly worth a visit, given the huge choice.  We stumbled across this restaurant by accident, whilst in the area, and out of all the places we visited this truly was such an enjoyable memorable experience. We went with waiters recommendations and ordered the veal and truffle pasta for mains and shared lemon cake for dessert. All of the food was absolutely delicious, particularly the melt in your mouth veal. Lovely relaxed atmosphere, reasonable prices for the high quality of food and attentive staff.  I would recommend this little place to anyone and would happily return again and again should I be back in Paris. Thank you üíú

A Michelin guide restaurant. Managed to get in without reservation on Ascension Day bcoz of the ample seatings. Food is great but I didn‚Äôt give 5* bcoz of the price. I‚Äôve found better restaurants on the next street at half the price.

I made a reservation for a special occasion today which you accepted. We arrived to find the restaurant closed and being painted!!! So we were not able to eat or drink and you totally spoiled our trip to Paris!! And now you send me a form asking  how we enjoyed your restaurant!! Appalling treatment!!
Pretty atmosphere, friendly staff! Good wine, but, unfortunately the soup I ordered was too salty. In my feelings - food is a bit overpriced.
We had a great breakfast and good service. We would like to try it for another meal on our next visit. I would recommend the omelettes!

Les Fous de L'Ie is one of our favorite places and whenever we have visitors in Paris we taken them here. Really great found in super nice setting. The staff are always very friendly and helpful with recommendations. Highly recommend!!

Nice restaurant opened all day long..a bit pricey but okay for a Michelin restaurant ...21/27/33‚Ç¨ for a 1/2/3 course lunch. Look is great and food delicious ! Staff is really nice ...highly recommended
Cute Restaurant, food and service were outstanding one of the best chicken breast I‚Äôve ever had, apps were also amazing and staff speaks English very well.
An upmarket French restraunt, The Chicken was cold and steak felt undercooked. Will remember to order medium next time.

Not only was the food delicious, the service was wonderful. The waiter and sommelier knew their stuff, were attentive without being pushy, just great. They took one look at us and spoke English without batting an eyelid (and there I was thinking I could pass as a Parisene..)

The food took ages (1hr+) to come. I think the servers noticed because they kept trying to refresh our bread. For mains, we got the risotto and chicken breast as recommended but for the wait, price and Michelin guide stickers from earlier years, I think it was just OK.
The chicken dish was a delight! It was juicy, meaty and well-seasoned. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Loved the food en vibe.
Best meal and service we‚Äôve had in Paris. Great staff, fabulous food, great Vin. Will recommend to all friends/family traveling here.
Fantastic chicken, amazing fish, super good service, fresh veggies. Ann allround fantastic experience. (just fix the lock on the ladies toilet please)

We've been coming to this restaurant since 2008, so have seen lots of changes and transformations, but it's always a lovely experience. Faultless service, lovely setting. But..... as a vegetarian I am not sure I will return. I usually choose 2 vegetarian starters or one starter and the cheese plate. But today none of the starters were vegetarian so I chose the one and only vegetarian dish. It was such a disappointment - a plate of vegetables, mostly broccoli and carrots. For ‚Ç¨22. How about adding lentils? Chickpeas? Nuts? So many easy options! When I complained the staff were very helpful and the chef added potatoes and grated cheddar which made the dish more substantial, but not exactly in line with the high standard of the other meat and fish dishes. So if you are vegetarian, I am not sure this is the best place for you!

I chose this restaurant for a special occasion. What can I say... the staff was outstanding! Not to mention the food, the location and the attention to detail! This restaurant deserves a 10 and I will definitely be back in the future! :)

The place has nice atmosphere (although we were surprised there is no outdoor seating as some of the reviews/websites mention there is an outdoor area) The food was hit and miss. Pate en croute was tasteless - completely inedible for me. Tenderloin veal was nice but aubergine accompanying it could have been better; I also feel that sauces for that dish are not the best match. Service was below average - they forgot to bring bread to our table at the beginning, I ordered wine to accompany the main dish and they served it when I was about to finish the dish. They poured the red wine in the glass from which I drank sparkling wine before, despite my comment that the glass is dirty. Waited really long for the check. Etc. So overall not a great experience which is a pity as had really high hopes for this restaurant.

The most disappointing of our meals in our week in Paris.  My wife ordered the stuffed veal and found it to be pretty tough.  My tuna, when asked if I wanted it rare, medium or well, was requested as ‚Äòmedium rare‚Äô.  It arrived overdone. The apple tart we shared for dessert was absolutely massive, very heavy and lacking in any real delicacy.  Very nice wait staff and service but that did not overshadow the disappointment in the meal.  BUT, in all fairness, my wife asked me to not say anything to the wait staff.
The most fabulous food, people, spirit (especially the pate/terrine)! We loved our evening and will return!
